content:
john Freitag

The WSU crew team launches a four during an afternoon practice on the Snake River Thursday Sept PERIOD   PERIOD

By Daniel Rodriguez
 Evergreen Rowing reporterSeptember  

With the National Championships coming up Washington State University womens rowing will travel to Priest River Idaho to begin their  season at the Head of the Pend Oreille Regatta Saturday PERIOD

The Pend Oreille is a unique race and a good event for the community Rowing Coach Jane LaRiviere said PERIOD

First of all in order to raise awareness of rowing in the community LaRiviere said they have a really beautiful barbeque that the community puts on for us and the competitors. after the barbeque there will be a rowby at  p.m PERIOD for an upclose rowing observation of the team PERIOD

Prior to that the teams will row down in front of the Priest River Yacht Club sing their respective fight songs and then row back for dinner she said PERIOD The whole town seems to come out. the first step toward the Championship begins Saturday PERIOD The WSU boats will compete in a 5km race open for all classes of rowers PERIOD The competition is a timedtrial competition where the boats race against the clock PERIOD

At the Regatta the womens rowing team will compete against crews from Gonzaga University Coeur d Alene High School Coeur d Alene Rowing Club Palouse Rowing Club Spokane River Rowing Association and Nelson Rowing Club PERIOD

Beginning her twelfth year as head coach LaRiviere said the team is ready and excited to play out of town PERIOD

The team has been training hard and I think everyone is excited to change the venue and get on a bus to go race somewhere she said PERIOD

The Regatta will begin at  a.m PERIOD and will consist of sweep and sculling style rowing PERIOD
